revised_title: Physiography and Geology of the Indian Ocean
tldr: This article discusses the physiography and geology of the Indian Ocean, focusing on its major divisions, including continental margins, ocean-basin floors, microcontinents, and fracture zones. The authors describe the topography, features, and geological formations of the Indian Ocean, such as abyssal plains, submarine canyons, and the Mid-Indian Ocean Ridge. The study provides an overview of the well-known areas of the ocean floor and the objectives of the Indian Ocean Expedition.
